result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kole T. Packard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kole T. Packard in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CM52, 14CM261 and 14CM260.  Called at 10:14 am  Def will plea guilty to OWI   Plea agreement, plea to Ct 1 14CM260, state will dismiss & consolidated Ct 2, Ct 3,4,5 to be dismissed and read in.  14CM261 & 15CM52 to be dismissed and read in.  BAC .197  Fine & cost, 60 days jail, 14 mo rev, 1 yr IID and alcohol assessement.  Plea questionnaire filed and reviewed.   OWI 2nd. Constitutional rights and jury trial reviewed.  Elements reviewed.  Court finds plea entered freely & voluntarily.  Court finds def understands charge, penalties and rights.  Def previously convicted 3-11-14 for OWI, def acknowledges.  Court accepts plea and finds def guilty.  BAC consolidated and balance of counts dismissed and read in.  Sentencing arguments presented by State.  Atty Koppelman presents sentencing arguments.  Statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by Court.  Court orders fine 1760.00, 60 days jail, 14 months revocation.  1 yr IID, alcohol assessment.  Def can transfer jail to Outagamie county if they can arrange.  Jail to commence 7-8-16 at 7:00 pm  Huber privileges.  Credit for 2 days.  Post conviction relief.  Issue of bond forfeitures.  Statement by Atty Bayne- Allison, State requesting forfeiture of some bond.  Statement by Atty Koppelman.  Court will forf $3000.00 and balance to fine & cost.  If any balance to poster
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Final pre-trial at 05-23-2016 03:30 pm.
Jury trial at 06-08-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Kole T. Packard in court by telephone with attorney James C. Koppelman appearing in person.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CM260, 14CM261, 15CM52, 14FO308, 14FO322 @ 2:45 p.m. State advises matter has been resolved. Plea and sentencing set. Bond remains.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Written Authorization to Appear and Plead Not Guilty

Attorney Corey Mehlos in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Authorization to appear filed.  Court read charge.  Def has posted $3000.00  Bond recommendations by State.  Response by Atty Mehlos.  Rebuttal argument.  Bond set by court.  Waive reading of complaint.  Not guilty plea entered.  Reserve jursdictional objections.  Plea accepted.  Bond to Atty for def's signature  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
